ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of interesting stuff about the history of sport in America
I learned a lot about how society got to where we are in American sports today.
Developed writing skills through reading responses and my first longer paper in college. Better understanding of the methods associated with history.

I learned about the history of sport in America from the post-Civil War era to the 1980s. I was able to learn more about the famous figures that shaped each decade of American sport and was also able to learn about the social, political, racial, cultural, and economic happenings in each decade with regard to sport and how it shaped sport throughout history.
I learned how the definition and identity of sport changed within the US from the 1880s-1980s.
After taking this course I improved my knowledge of both American history and the history of American sport. I learned how to critically read and analyze multiple readings with given prompts.

I learn a lot about the history of sports and how American and universal sports were changed. I learned about how sports evolved for women, African Americans, colleges, professional leagues and more. The insights I develop were how sports really is a key part to Americas greatness and happiness.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really interesting and engaging classes
The content of the course was very interesting and the class discussions were enjoyable. The amount of reading for each week was significant.

Could be better based for discussion but the course touched on very interesting material with relevance with Yale. Really powerful to also see primary source material relevant to the course that was from Yale Athletics.

The strengths of the course included the excellent selection of readings and sources, the format of the course with the weekly quizzes that kept me accountable and papers spread out through the semester that never felt overwhelming, and the in-class discussions where Professor Gleason would highlight the important parts of the decade and then allow us to discuss and answer questions that helped us understand the content of the course. The only weakness of the course was that some more resources could have been provided for the papers, but overall I felt like I was given the tools needed to do well in the course.
I have no recommendations.

There are no weaknesses to this course. It is very well organized and I loved how it was structured. We were always given enough time to do the readings and the quizzes were not challenging if we completed the readings.

The strengths are that we communicated a lot in this class and understood a lot of new concepts given to us. 
There were no weaknesses in this course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yea definitely because its good classes and the assignments were interesting

Yes, if they are interested in history. This is a course not only relevant to people who enjoy sports since sports is a thing that is constantly changing and is very relevant for how society is built.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. You will learn so much about sports in America and have a true appreciation of history in a field that is fun to study and analyze. The course is not overwhelming and you're given the support to do well while learning a lot. I truly enjoyed this course, and if you get a spot in the class, I would absolutely recommend it. You start making connections to modern-day sport and other sporting events in history, which is a really cool realization to have. Highly recommend!
I definitely would! This course was my favorite course I had taken my first year.
Absolutely yes. It improved my reading, writing, and class discussion. I always felt welcome to share my thoughts and opinions on whatever we were discussing.

Yes, I would recommend this course to an another student. The reason is because from this course you can learn so much history on how sports were formed around the world and how much impact sports had in the United States.
